data.title: People's Party seeks a provincial win
data.description: The drum is rolling once again for the People

data.title: Police bust two Chinese syndicates
data.description: Police have dismantled two Chinese scam networks responsible for more than 700 million fraudulent calls and one million fake SMS messages over just three days.

data.title: Hoping to break its duck
data.description: Hoping to break its duck

data.title: Government willing to explain agreement's benefits
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra insists that the government is ready to explain its decision to back a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Thailand and Cambodia on both countries

data.title: 30 years of global learning
data.description: In an era when the world is all about cultural diversity and endless possibilities, growing up means not only a path toward academic achievement but also embracing a broader perspective of being a global citizen.

data.title: Govt approves big BMA debt fufilment budget
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Council (BMC) has approved the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration

data.title: Govt willing to explain agreement's benefits
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra insists that the government is ready to explain its decision to back a Memorandum of Understanding between Thailand and Cambodia on both countries

data.title: Ex-PM proposes reforms amid global shifts
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra has proposed economic reform and suggested Thailand be prepared for geopolitical change.

data.title: Experts in medicine and public health honoured
data.description: Two winners of the Prince Mahidol Award this year in the fields of medicine and public health were announced on Thursday.

data.title: Senator blames insurgents for Songkhla statue attack
data.description: A senator has blamed this week’s grenade attacks in Songkhla on the Barisan Revolusi Nasional Melayu-Patani ( BRN )  insurgent  group, saying it intended to discredit a policy to strengthen multiculturalism and promote economic development in the troubled southern border region.

data.title: Thaksin ‘paid for entire hospital stay’
data.description: Former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  paid 8,500 baht a night for his room, along with all other medical expenses, for the entire six-month period that he stayed at  Police General Hospital , an inquiry heard on Friday.

data.title: Social media activist faces arrest for false iCon story
data.description: The Criminal Court on Friday approved an arrest warrant for a social media activist for making false statements about a  cryptocurrency  transaction allegedly linked to the founder of  The iCon Group , the direct sales company accused of operating a  pyramid scheme.

data.title: Second Australian dies after Laos poisoning
data.description: A second Australian teenager has died of suspected  methanol  poisoning, bringing to six the number of  foreign tourists  who have died after apparently drinking  tainted alcohol  in Laos.

data.title: More rain pounding southern provinces
data.description: Heavier rainfall is affecting Thailand

data.title: More tourists visit Koh Samui
data.description: Two cruise liners with over 2,000 tourists have arrived at Koh Samui in Surat Thani, with at least 10 ships scheduled to visit the island until next month.

data.title: Court rejects petition over Thaksin's political influence
data.description: The Constitutional Court on Friday rejected a petition seeking to bar billionaire former premier Thaksin Shinawatra from interfering in the ruling Pheu Thai Party and colluding with it to overthrow the constitutional monarchy.

data.title: Boys praised for returning wallet found in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA — Two 14-year-old boys received public praise for returning a wallet containing cash and identification documents to police after finding it in an ice bucket outside a shopping mall in Pattaya on Thursday night.

data.title: Constitutional Court rejects petition over ex-PM Thaksin's political influence
data.description: The Constitutional Court on Friday rejected a petition seeking to stop billionaire former premier Thaksin Shinawatra from interfering in the running of the ruling Pheu Thai party.

data.title: Thai Lion Air mulls flights
data.description: Thai Lion Air is considering operating flights to Nakhon Phanom as part of the government

data.title: iCon fraud victims can claim assets
data.description: Victims of the scandal-hit The iCon Group can now regain their assets from the Anti-Money Laundering Office (Amlo), the Department of Special Investigation (DSI) said yesterday.

data.title: Cash handout plan is 'probably illegal'
data.description: A former election commissioner has pointed out that the second phase of the 10,000-baht cash handout scheme risks violating the law as the government is due to distribute the money to 4 million elderly Thais during Chinese New Year, which is a few days before the elections of the chiefs of provincial administrative organisations (PAOs).

data.title: Govt to   build new bridge to Cambodia
data.description: The government is building a bridge that will permanently link Chanthaburi with Pailin province in Cambodia at a cost of about 15 million baht.

data.title: Lone dugong spotted in  Trang survey
data.description: Only one dugong was found during a week-long survey of a seagrass meadow in Trang that is known for dugong sightings, raising concerns about the species

data.title: Myanmar workers protest at being duped
data.description: SAMUT SAKHON: About 100 Myanmar workers protested in front of a factory in Muang district after they paid a group of Thai brokers 3,000-7,000 baht each but did not receive the promised jobs.

data.title: Double majority backers prevail in referendum wrangle
data.description: The Senate has prevailed in the ongoing debate over the requirements for holding a  referendum  to amend the Thai  constitution .

data.title: House panel ‘cannot summon’ Thaksin
data.description: A House committee looking into claims that former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  received privileged treatment at  Police General Hospital  during his detention there does not have the authority to summon him or agencies linked to the matter, according to the Department of Corrections.

data.title: Scrapping Cambodia pact ‘not feasible’
data.description: A petition by Thai citizens to cancel the 2001 Memorandum of Understanding ( MoU ) between Thailand and  Cambodia  regarding territorial claims is not legally feasible, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

data.title: Highway upgrade improves Bangkok-East travel
data.description: A section of  Highway 3481 , linking Bangkok to eastern provinces such as Chachoengsao and Prachin Buri, has been expanded to four traffic lanes from two, improving transport between the capital and the East.

data.title: Man arrested with dozens of tiger skin products
data.description: NAKHON SAWAN - Police have arrested a man with a wide range of products made from animal skins, mostly  tiger  hides, that he usually sold online.

data.title: Severe flooding alert for southern provinces
data.description: Southern provinces along the Gulf of Thailand and their neighbours are bracing for the impact of torrential rain expected to pound the region until at least Saturday.

data.title: Briton falls to death in Phuket storm drain
data.description: PHUKET - A British man on holiday with his family was found dead in an open storm drain in Kathu district of this tourist island on Wednesday.

data.title: Retail loyalty programme apologises for customer data breach
data.description: The 1 Co, part of the Central Group, has apologised for a  data breach  affecting its  loyalty programme  members, saying an initial investigation found no flaws in its systems

data.title: BMA 'sorry' for cycle lane chaos
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has issued an apology and reopened a lane to traffic in Soi Sukhumvit 39 a day after closing it for a bicycle lane.

data.title: MP seeks middle path in referendum majority row
data.description: A United Thai Nation (UTN) list-MP yesterday called for a middle path as the House-Senate committee on referendums met to thrash out its differences over the size of the majority required to pass a charter referendum.

data.title: Police cadet school admits sexual harassment
data.description: The Royal Police Cadet Academy (RPCA) has confirmed a media report that a first-year  police cadet  was  sexually harassed  by an instructor and the instructor’s friend.

data.title: Jury still out on Thaksin's 'dual citizenship'
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa yesterday downplayed reports that former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra
